antiPatterns.name: Big Bang
antiPatterns.description: A strategy often preferred by large vendors where an entire system has to be built "at once".
antiPatterns.consequences: The antipattern increases the burden of the users.
antiPatterns.cause: Due to fine-grained interfaces the services are not independent enough and an incremental development is not possible.
antiPatterns.solution: Use of coarse grained user-oriented interfaces and decomposing the required capabilities into autonomous services.
